so it seems that in a "community" filled with people who fling around insults like %%%got, get cancer, and serious death wishes, the word retard is worth a perma suspension...........

it seems that riot prefers to ban people who say retards, instead of doing something about the people that either enable, or are the origin of  making others toxic ( and no, i do not consider using the word retards toxic enough to be banned AT ALL, not in a community where various other real and harsh insults seem to slip by unnoitced) it seems you are an awesome player according to riot if you run circles around minions for 25 minutes, spam pings all over the map till you are locked out for a few seconds, to start it again as soon as you can, while not saying anything in chat, but at the same time pissing off 4 other players by your behavior....well sorry riot, but those are the people you should punish, not the people that get fed up with it and say something in chat about it.

either root out the cause, or dont bother at all, but this half/half work you are doing is very distastefull to long term players.

so yeah, just letting you guys know that riot is on a bann happy spree for small words....

Kickthem

A words social context is often not congruent with the definition. For example, @sshole is best defined as irritating when not used as a body part. That doesn't mean it isn't offensive or negative to call someone an @sshole or their gameplay @ssholish. 

F@ck is defined similarly as "to ruin" which makes the phrase "Where the F@ck are you going?" make sense. But that doesn't mean people read it as "It's ruining you to go that direction... where are you going" they most likely view it as "F@ck you for going in that direction". 

Riot has gone to great lengths to encompass not just the words themselves but their meaning as perceived by millions and take into account how often you exhibit this behavior and attempt not to censor any one word but use a general rule for limiting that kind of language and behavior. That rule is "Don't Be a Jerk".  You were being a jerk. And it seems you did it often enough that you got banned.

That being said. Our community OVERWHELMINGLY agrees that hate speech (racist, sexist, discriminatory and bigoted, etc.) should be dealt with SWIFTLY AND HARSHLY.  There are MANY people who will lawyer for your right to use a word when it falls into that category. But in general, when you say that word in the manner in which you say it, there's no excuse for demeaning anyone that way and should you really want a word that means "ineffective in some way" I suggest you explain in a way that isn't negative why you think their actions weren't effective and take some time to help them make a better decision. Perhaps use words from this: http://www.wordhippo.com/what-is/another-word-for/ineffective.html

For more information:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/ENOw3GtM-permanently-suspended-common-posts-and-common-answers

You're very negative, berating teammates, and not being a team player. None of this helps in any way to contribute to a win at all. It certainly is *punishment* worthy.

Emphasis on punishment, because the permaban is a culmination of several punishments after showing a long pattern of poor behavior in games. You weren't permabanned specifically for what you said in these logs, so saying that the logs are "permaban worthy" is misleading. You were punished, yes. And you happened to be at a point where your next punishment level was a permaban.

That's how the system works. Your first punishment is a 10-game chat restriction. Then a 25-game restriction, and then a 14-day ban. If you don't get the hint by then and are still causing problems, the next punishment is a permaban. 

So had you only done what was showed in the chat logs posted, having never received a punishment by the system before? Certainly, these shouldn't have granted a permaban. None of this is bad enough to be skipping the lower punishments and jumping right to a permanent ban. It would have only been a 10-game chat restriction in this case. But, since you'd climbed through the punishment tiers already, you received a permaban.

as far as i can recall, i never got a 2 week suspension on this account, so this perma ban business comes as a surprise to me.

It's a known fact that Riot does in fact bump up accounts to 2-week or permaban status if the offenses in question are really, REALLY bad. If you're still confused about your ban then feel free to file a Support Ticket or ask Lyte on his ask.fm page about it. Since others have tried to explain to you why you got banned, I'll include the official Riot stances from [Understanding the Tribunal](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=2726400): 

>**1) What's the point of having a language filter if I can get banned for 'adult' language?**
a) We aren't out to punish players who use adult language; in fact, very few players are ever banned for saying stuff like "f***, I missed that skill shot" or "damn, f***ing close game!" However, the language filter is not an excuse to verbally abuse someone in the game. When you verbally abuse or harass someone by calling them "f***ing ******" or "n*gger noob", that's when you've crossed the line and will be punished by the Tribunal. I've said this before and I'll say it again, we aren't trying to clean online games of adult language; we're trying to reform or get rid of jerks who like to verbally abuse and harass other players.


>**4) That player in my game was far worse than me. Why am I banned???**
a) I'll keep this one simple: retaliation isn't OK. Reacting to a toxic player by being toxic just incites that player to be even worse--it also ruins the game for up to 8 other players. It is far, far worse to watch two people yelling at each other all game than it is to watch 1 player ranting into blank space. Almost everyone in the game can find someone out there that behaves worse than they do--but so what? Finding someone worse doesn't justify your behavior or justify retaliation. We expect more out of our players. What players often don't realize is... those other players in your game that you thought were worse? Nearly 100% of the time, those players were banned even before you were. If someone is being toxic, just report them and move on. If you retaliate, both of you will be banned. It's really that simple.
